definition: like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: Mr. Bullen looks over at her and half smiles.
sentences.chinese: 布倫先生擡起頭，似笑非笑地看過來。

sentences.english: He gave a strange half laugh and leaned back in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 他帶着一種奇怪的似笑非笑的表情向後靠在椅子上。

sentences.english: Mona lisa is smiling, but more than a smile.
sentences.chinese: 蒙娜麗莎在微笑，但似笑非笑。

sentences.english: October 27, 2009-- Don't be fooled by the kindly eyes and half smiles.
sentences.chinese: 不要被這些和藹的眼神和似笑非笑的表情所迷惑。

sentences.english: Smile don't smile of, chief executive officer's adult interrupted the other party.
sentences.chinese: 似笑非笑的，總裁大人打斷了對方。

definition: to cast sidelong glances at sb
to have a smile on one's face
to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
